moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6: The Queen's gambit, one of the favourite openings of most World champions.
moves.3... d5 4. Nc3 dxc4: Gambit accepted leads to sharp and lively complications.
moves.5. e4: 5. e3 is the more solid move.
moves.7. e5: Slightly impetuous move by White. 7. Bxc4 was better.
moves.7... cxd4: Kosteniuk pins Anand's knight on c3!
moves.10... Be7 11. exf6 gxf6 12. Bh4 e5: Black has a strong center and sufficient compensation for the knight. Theory suggests 12...Rc8 which Kosteniuk played once against Maya Chiburdanidze.
moves.13. Bxc4 a6 14. Qb3: Anand makes his first mistake here allowing a knight fork by Black. This game is full of forks. 14. Qc2 would have maintained a good initiative for White.
moves.14... Na5 15. Bxf7+: A bishop sac by Anand! A surprising mistake by Anand which leads to decisive material loss.
moves.15... Kf8 16. Qd3: Kosteniuk thought for some time whether to accept the bishop on f7 immediately and played the in between move next.
moves.16... Bb5 17. Qd2 Kxf7 18. Qh6: Anand played this move very quickly which Kosteniuk calls a mistake and shows how to win from here. 18. Kb1 is suggested by Kosteniuk.
moves.18... Qc8+ 19. Kb1 Qf5: A powerful centralizing queen move which sets up a deadly pin of the knight on e4.
moves.20. Rhe1 Bc6 21. Ka1: Losing decisively. 21. Nfd2 could have been played. Blitz game error!
moves.21... Bxe4: Material loss for Anand and his game is lost from here.
moves.22... exd4 23. Rxd4 Rad8: Kosteniuk misses a mating combination here!
moves.24... Nc6: Time pressure is telling on both players now.
moves.26... Qg6: and Kosteniuk does not accept! Time pressure.
moves.27. Qf4: White cannot exchange queens as he is behind in material.
This is a strong move setting up a deadly fork next.
moves.36. Reg1 Bc5: Kosteniuk is falling behind on the clock which showed only 10 seconds left, and Anand might have pinned his hopes on the clock.
moves.40. Bh6+ Kg8 41. Qb4 Red8: Anand resigns. A sweet win for Kosteniuk against the reigning world champion who is widely known as the best Blitz player in the world today.
